wikipedia_page.main: Elsie Plant (1890–1982) was a suffragette, socialist and birth control activist. She lived most of her life in Stockport, seven miles from Manchester. She was an enthusiastic campaigner of the suffrage movement.  Following her campaigning as a suffragette, she and her husband became key figures in Stockport's Labour Fellowship. She had three daughters: Aileen, Roma and Joyce. Aileen became a nursery school head teacher and traveller; Roma was a business woman and retail owner, and Joyce was a writer, teacher and philosopher.
